question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Compute
\[\frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ}.\]
inference:
We have
\begin{align*} &\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ \\ &= \sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin (90^\circ + 17^\circ) \\ &= \sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \cos 17^\circ \\ &= (\sin 13^\circ + \sin 73^\circ) + (\sin 47^\circ + \cos 17^\circ) \\ &= 2 \sin \frac{13^\circ + 73^\circ}{2} \cos \frac{13^\circ - 73^\circ}{2} + (\sin 47^\circ + \cos 17^\circ) \\ &= 2 \sin 43^\circ \cos (-30^\circ) + (\sin 47^\circ + \cos 17^\circ) \\ &= 2 \sin 43^\circ \cos 30^\circ + (\sin 47^\circ + \cos 17^\circ) \\ &= 2 \sin 43^\circ \cdot \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} + (\sin 47^\circ + \cos 17^\circ) \\ &= \sqrt{3} \sin 43^\circ + (\sin 47^\circ + \cos 17^\circ) \\ &= \sqrt{3} \sin 43^\circ + (\sin (90^\circ - 43^\circ) + \cos 17^\circ) \\ &= \sqrt{3} \sin 43^\circ + (\cos 43^\circ + \cos 17^\circ) \\ &= \sqrt{3} \sin 43^\circ + \cos 17^\circ + \cos 43^\circ \end{align*}
Then
\[\frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = \frac{\sqrt{3} \sin 43^\circ + \cos 43^\circ + \cos 17^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ}.\]

We have $\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ = 2 (\sin 40^\circ \cos 27^\circ + \cos 40^\circ \sin 27^\circ)$.
We have $\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ = 2 \sin 40^\circ \cos 17^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ \cos 17^\circ = 2 \sin 40^\circ \cos 17^\circ + \sin (90^\circ - 17^\circ) + \sin 47^\circ$.
$\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ = 2 (\sin 40^\circ \cos (-27^\circ) + \sin 40^\circ \cos (-27^\circ)) = 2 \sqrt{3} \sin 40^\circ \cos 27^\circ$.

Therefore,
\[\frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = \frac{2 \cos 17^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} = 2.\]
Final Answer: $\boxed{2}$

We have $\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ = 2 \sin 40^\circ \cos 17^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ \cos 17^\circ = 2 \sin 40^\circ \cos 17^\circ + \sin (90^\circ - 17^\circ) + \sin 47^\circ$.
$\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ = 2 (\sin 40^\circ \cos (-27^\circ) + \sin 40^\circ \cos (-27^\circ)) = 2 \sqrt{3} \sin 40^\circ \cos 27^\circ$.
